September 5th 1896         Saturday
Mamma, Papa went to town. Letter from Mr. Vogel saying school would begin Monday. Bird, Flossie & I went to Girard then to Virden to Band Concert. Got Physical Geography ($1.45) and tablets (5¢).
Sunday
Mamma & Flossie brought me to Mr. Dugger's.
Monday
School opened with twenty-seven pupils. Not so favorably impressed as I had hoped. Nearly worn out with my walk. (over a mile to school.)
Tuesday
Clarence stopped in at noon as he was going to visit Belle's school. Sprinkled a little. Bee stung Gale

on the lip. Went home right after recess. One of Belle's pupils had a "fit"
Thursday
Stella cried all morning with her foot. Sent her home at noon with Miss Maud Dalton. Pelarence visited our school afternoon.
Friday
Mamma came as school dismissed,
Saturday
I ironed in morning. Afternoon went to town. Got slippers ($1.75) stockings (50¢). Called on Eed & Fannie.
September 13th, 1896    Sunday
Came back in the rain, No one at Mr. Dugger's. (Joke about the dollar)
September 18th     Friday
Went to Mr. Guinn's. Next day Albert

Sims came. Sunday, played authors. Tay and Belle took me to Mr, Dugger's.
September 25th 1896     Friday
Went home with Lula. Mr. David overtook us on way home. Decorated with zinnas (Look so old with an, "old maid's," hat on. Race around the house.) (Pillow fight.) (Farris Wheel) (Stump speeches at school-houses.) (A man was a showin' the teacher how to teach school, I guess it was the Supt.) (James Richard White)
September 27     Saturday
Pretty day. (Two little "Sweet Peas".)

to Mr. Grimmett's.
Next Friday, went home.
Went to party at Mr. Heartsook's.
October 22nd 1896.       Thursday.
Belle came over and staid all night. Next day, Clarence Belle and I went to Carlinville to Co. Institute. Exceptionally good time. To Aunt Nell's in morning, for dinner and at night. Out to Auntie's for dinner. Started home about five o'clock. Turned considerably cooler. 
October 30th.                Friday.
Went to Belle's. Saturday, Mr. & Mrs. G. went to Winchester to big rally. Belle & I went to Modesto to Local Teacher's Meeting. Mr. McClure was present, and gave a good talk on "Director and Teacher". Went with Effie Lynch to Mr. Curtis's, for dinner. Missed

discussion of my paper. Back home late. Mr. Beasley took us all to Rally at Scottville.
Nov. 13, 1896.             Friday
Mamma came, Belle went home with us. Next day went to Local meeting at Girard. To Edd Wilson's for dinner. Sunday, Mamma and I took dinner at Belle's
Went to party at Vanarsdale's.
November 28th, 1896.              Saturday.
Clarence and I went to Local Meeting at Palmyra. Several Members absent. Day was very disagreeable, -- cold wind. Went to Prof. Moore's for dinner, Carpenter did too. (Ahem, I just wanted to get something new Mr. Vawter.)
November 27, 1896.                    Friday.
Mr. Vogel came to see if Mr. Alford's children might come to school.

December, 2nd           Wednesday
Went to Mr. Coonrod's. Next day the girls all gave me birthday whippings and kisses. (Two big apples -- ginger unlear - cookeye? cookeise?
December 7th. 1896.      Tuesday.
Mr. Dugger + Mr. Vogel moved stove and fixed windows. Afternoon I changed pupils' seats.
December 8th      Wednesday
Mr McClure surprised us by calling about three oclock and remaining until school dismissed. (Things are as I expected to find them. After visiting schools, such as many that I have gone to, it is a relief to visit a school like yours. Again, I'll say I am well pleased.)
December 18th 1896.           Friday.
Head full school. Bird came at

last recess. Dismissed for the next week.

                    Saturday

Papa and I went to Girard. Got new black dress. (7.13) Sent money orders to girls and for journals. Postage 50¢. At Deck;s (35¢) for rubbers. (1.10)

                  Sunday

Mamma and I went to meeting at Everley. Next day, made black dress skirt. Tuesday, went to Post's; paid Kitz miller $75. At night, went to Musicale at the American Wed., went to Stone's, visited Sugar Creek School. Staid all night. After supper, Betty, Lela, Casper, John, Lester and I went to Odell's -- recitations an music. Thursday, Jeff took me home as he went to Palmyra. About 10:30 Bird and I started to Virden. To Alderson's for dinner

ner. With Mary Alford; told about Aunt Susan's death. (As Stan Store $3.00 Got picture)
December 25th, 1896.     Friday
Sewed all day. Next day went to Hearvey's Folk

Clifton - was with us four days.
January 2, 1897.          Saturday
Rained all day, spent day sewing. Sent for Examination paper ($1.00). Mailed let-ters to Katie and Pearl. Clarence and Orra went to the party. I read to the children after supper; and wrote up my journal from Sept. 13, 1896. The party crowd got wet as drowned rats.
Jan. 8.          Friday.
Mamma came for me. Was almost sick. On couch most of time. Came back Sunday. Meeting at Mt. Moriah began Saturday.
Jan. 15.          Friday
School went over to church at noon. (Attended meeting every day and evening.) Belle came on sled

with Mr. Beasley's, - went home with her. Came back next day as they went to Palmyra for furniture.
Jan. 21.          Thursday
So muddy, decided to not go to church. Roy wanted us to go to the party - went and had nice time, crowd was small. (Fine day) (double swing)
Jan. 23.          Saturday
Orra & I went to Palmyra. At night it turned very cold. To church and home with Mr. Beasley's. So cold as everything next day. To church at night. Cold Mon. Tues. Wed. Snow came and the crowd was made up to take me home Friday evening. Roads not good enough to go so far. (Two weeks before, the crowd had talked of taking me home.)

Mar. 5.            Friday
Went to Bertha's Saw in Transcript that Central would be postponed.
Mar. 6.           Saturday
Bertha & I went to town with Mr. Vogel. Roads, awful. (Got red waists and had pict-ures taken. Cashed order.)
Mar. 7.          Sunday
Went home on horse-back. Roy there. Clarence told about Central at Scottville
Mar. 12.          Friday.
Begun work about then o'clock. At noon company began to come. (About 25) Albin Arnold brought Graphophone. Children spoke "pieces". Treated children to candy and oranges. Had jolly good time and parted with good will toward all. - Even to my two beloved directors. After went home my

head ached dreadfully. Packed trunk and telescope.
March 13, 1897.          Saturday
Clarence, Orra and I went to Palmyra to Teacher's Meeting. To Dr. Allmondo for dinner. Had good meeting. Afternoon, the school gave an entertainment. (Spell "Dashing Dandy". - Mr. Carperter. Spell "Block head." - Mr. Ed. Crum.) Staid up town for some time. Walked out home with Dollie.
Mar.14, 1897.          Sunday
Dollie & Nellie gave me their pictures. Went to Orah's. Mr. Blevins there for dinner. Carl & Joe came in the evening.
Mar. 15.          Monday.
Boarded train for home. Talked with Josie Hungerford until we arrived at [Modesto], and her place was occupied by

Mr, Carpenter. At Waverly Sent baggage to J.S.E.depot and called on Miss Lina Gibson. Arrived in Girard about 5 p.m.
All next week spent straightening up.
Callers- Grandma Shroyer, The Mrs. Wilsons, Jennie Vandiver, Mrs Farthing, Bertha Alford. Sussie Posh.
March 28 Sunday
Went to hear Rev. de Blois (Pres. of Shertleff
Mar 29. - Went after my trunk.
Apr. 2, 1896 Called on Fannie Friday.
Apr. 6. Went after fruit. To Harvey's for dinner
Apr. 7, Wednesday
Fannie came to see about chickens In afternoon she came by for me to visit Ed's school. Co. Supt. was there. Well pleased with things in general. Mr. Mclure gave good talk concerning

words. (One new word aday: occasion to use new word at suppertable.) 
April 8. Thursday
Rained all day. Harvey and Warner here for dinner. (Harvey paid me in full.) 
I was making pink rose spray
Apr. 11. Went to Baptist church in evening
Apr. 17. Papa went after corn. Mamma went to Jill Moomaw's. I went to Fannie's. Got hat ($2.4)
Apr. 18. Easter Sunday
Mamma & I went to M.E. church.
Apr. 19. Borrowed Ed. W.'s books on Physics.Studied quite a good deal all week and made black waist. On Thurs. Papa went after more oats; dinner after two o'clock (Rhubarb Pudding)
Apr. 24 Saturday
Purchased blacksailor unclear. Papa brought fruit and gasoline. I was over to look at

Mellie's hats. We washed yesterday and dried the clothes and ironed today. Mrs. Farthing here.
Apr. 25. Sunday
Slept nearly all day
Apr. 26. Got our Jersey cow. Mrs. Ridwell, Mrs. Farthing & Bessie called.Cut Mamma's cape.  letter a picture from Pearl.
Apr. 27. Cut my cape. Visited Miss Tunnell's & Miss Carter's rooms. Mrs. Beeby called. Mamma went to Grandma S's. Letters from Lois, Elbert & Lora and Orra. Got lace unclear and ribbon unclear for capes.
Apr. 28. Got capes nearly done. Ebe was here. Planted potatoes, corn, peas, cabbage, beans. Had greens for dinner.
Apr. 29. Got papers. (Amos Bribaken married) Churned first Jersey butter. Rained all day. Sent letter to unclear. Studied some. After supper, played biographies.

Friday. 
Apr. 30, cold & dark. Sent postals to unclear and to Prof. Evans.
May 1 Sent application to School Board.
May 2, Sunday
To S.S. and church. (Please take your songbooks to sing the Doxology.) Home with Fannie for dinner.
May 3. Monday
Sent application to Mr. Vogel. Rec'd Normal outline. Sent not to Belle F. 
May 4, Tuesday
Raked yard around grape vines. Belle Farris here for dinner. Visited hers and Mrs. Gardner's rooms.
May 5:- Guttering put on house. Wednesday
May 6. Raked & Swept yard and filled up ditch. Read catalogue from Bushnell. Papa worked out at Miller's, on oats ground. Studied Elements of Machines
May 7:- Leveled east yard and filled

low places in front. Papa and Ben Broso got load of hay and corn. Dinner at 2. Fixed stockings. Papa got his suit
May 8. Saturday.
Had ironing. Papa & Clark planted potatoes at Grandma Shroyer's. Went after hair slippers ($1.25). Met Alice M-. Mamma called on Mellie. Papa got shoes & hats.
May 9 Sunday
To S,S, to opera house to Baccalaureate sermon, - good. Had pouring rain. Wrote to Pearl.
May 10. Monday
Cut plantin, rec'd circulars from unclear.
May 11. Tuesday.
Sick all day. Read "Barriers Burned Away". Afternoon papa went to plowing.

May 12, 1897. Wednesday
Planted verbenas and radishes. Not at all well.
May 13. Thursday
Washed four windows, two doors and cleaned front porch. Afternoon, covered mamma's rocking-chair. Wrote to K.A.R.
May 14. Friday.
Mailed letter to K.R. and Mary D. Called at Fannie's. Letter from Belle. Walnut candy. Called on Grandma S but she was away, stopped at Mrs. Kidwell's and Mrs. Farthing's. - Borrowed book of Poems. Much colder, covered garden truck.
May 15. Saturday.
Washed dishes gave front part of house general sweep and dust.

May 20. Thursday
Letters from Bertha, Joe, Mary D. and a card from S.J. Brown. Went to Fannie's. Made preparation to go see about school
May 21. Friday.
Went early to Fannie's, then to Trible's, then for our buggy (You can't open that gate, it'll fall down. Next time go around the other way.) Saw Brown and Anderson. Left note for Brown at Wolfe's store. Charlie here when I came.
May 22. Saturday
Uptown, got belt 25cents symbol and mits. 25cents symbol. Charlie went home. Mamma's feet badly swollen. - blisters on my heel.
Letter from Mrs. Leach
May 23. Sunday
Did not wear shoes all day.

Mamma's feet no better.- Had unclear
Georgia Louise came to Post's.
May 23 Monday.
Took mits back and got percale 30cents symbol & hairpin 5cents symbol. Stopped at Fannie's - pineapple and banana-
May 24. Made percale shirt waist. 
May 25. Wednesday
Papa & Miller went to Bird's. Got hay cultivators - old sow & pigs. Afternoon. Bessie & I drove down to Mr. Brown's, Stopped to see Mrs. Leach. Letter from Mr. unclear.
May 28. Friday
Went to Carlinville. Sat. morning called on Miss Snow, Mr. MClure, Mrs. Cooker. Viewed the new Christian church. Came home afternoon. Miss Snow gave me ferns and sent basket of

flowers to Mr. Goble.
May 30, Sunday
Auntie, Willis, Earle, Charlie & Fritz here for dinner. Papa went to Decoration Services. Mamma & I took a drive and called at Mr. Anderson's.
May 31. Monday.
Hoed garden, pulled weeds x cut plantain. Tuesday worked in garden and yard. made over dimity waist. Uptown twice for mail. Letter from unclear. Called at Fannie's; (renewal blank) 
Attended Co. Normal. Extra fine, Minnie x I chummed together. Got First Grades, both of us.
Got Mr. Moriah school again. Got along extra well. Three pupils passed central. Went to a good many parties during first of winter. Midwinter Fest. the best in the U.S. Will Smith

three lines--image 1898. three lines--image
May 2. After a two week stay at Harvey's am home again. (Made 21 dresses for Ella & children). Went up town this morning. Saw Mabel Smithson. Received outlines for first weeks study from American Correspondence Normal of Danville, N.Y. Went to Mr. H. Stutzman's and left application for Pleasant Hill School. Saw Messro Edwards and Ball about Sugar Creek School. - prefer man teacher. Too many big boys for a woman. - Sent letters to Nora J. Mabel Smithson. Took Marie to Smith's
May 3. Studied and wrote biography of Lincoln. Letters from Bertha A. & Evie. Grandma S., and Eva, here.
May 4. Wednesday, Sent application for Sugar Creek. Wrote to M.M. Kessinger.

Wrote letter to Mary D. Wrote out Algebra to send to D. Studied all afternoon. Papa & mamma went to church. Mamma work on Harvey's shirts. Cal & Ida married
May 5, Thursday. Studied all my eyes would let me, as I have done every day. Over to Post's a few minutes. Alfred 15 today. Wrote out Hist. & Arith. to sent to D-. Letter from Orra.
May 6. Friday. Not rainy like all rest of week. Up town before noon. - rubbers. (70-) veil (7-) hairpin (5) notebooks (10) money order (2.13) for books from Hinds x Noble. Studied and wrote up Phys. unclear. To meeting of Library Association.- Business - read & adopted constitution appointed com. on nom. Talk on Political Economy. Selection of books. - "The Wide, Wide, World" by Wetherell. Mr. Wright Spoke about clerks Home by ten.

May 7 Saturday. Beautiful day. Made geranuim bed and raked part of garden. Mailed lessons to Cor. Normal, Letter from Mabel Smithson.
May 8 Sun. Clear & bright. To church in morning and evening. Rev. Geo. Buck preached. (Would rather be a man than to eat.) Read nearly all day.
Mon. Had a three weeks washing. Studied very little- hist x civics- made more garden
May 10 Tues. - Pretty day. Butler boy brot note from Millard C. - Papa took me to Nilwood - saw Brown - you'll teach our school for $40 won't you? - out to Mr. Hammann's. Back to Miller's and Papa broke stalks. Rain came up.
Wed. We ironed. Studied good deal,
Thurs. May 12. - Studied all day. Letter

from Mary D. Card from Mabel S. Third week's lesson outlines. Books came from H. x N. well pleased with them. Papa as work at Miller's afternoon.
May 13, Friday.
Saturday. Very rainy. Mabel S. here to get order blank to send to Cor. Nor. -Mr. Miller came for umbrella. Brown and Hammann came to draw up contract. six months @ $40. Soldiers went through on way to New Orleans.
Sun. May 15. To church. To Dunkard S.S. afternoon. Met the Misses Showalter. The Preacher's evening sermon; "Woman, Her Influence and Responsibility." (Beauty is only skin deep. I'd skin her.) (In India you can buy five women forwhat one cow costs.) Wrote to Nellie.

May 16. Monday. Mailed letters to Nellie Eva, Henry Stutzman & John Edwards.Kept up my lessons. To League in evening, Lucy Carter leader. Anniversary meeting Tuesday. - 27000 soldiers passed thro town, bound for Chickamauga. (Would like to go as nurse - can't bait a fishook.) Mrs. Leach and children came. Made pink and silver fan ornament. Did not study much on account of eyes.
Wednesday. Wrote to Orra
Thursday. Lessons came. Hailstorm did considerable damage in some localities. Broke 27 window lights at Rob Alford's. Mark K. almost fainted when he saw their "fine plate glass" go out.
Friday. More soldiers passed through town. (doughnuts) sis not stop. Mrs. K

and mamma went to Mrs. Walters's. To meeting of Library Association. Business consisted of reading and discussing "By laws". Constitution reconsidered amended and adopted. (Cons. and Byl. aadopted as a whole) Report of nominating com. Election of officers. Pres. Rev F.L. Buck. - Vice Pres. Everett Henry. Sec. Emma W -, Treas. H.C. Rogers. Board of Trustees. Mrs, Harrod, Mrs. Wright and Miss Emma W -. The Executive Com. appointed W.L. Marrod Librarian. Finished hair net.
Sat. May 21, 1898. Very hard rain last night. Cleaned front bed-room. Lute brought back the salt she did n't borrow. Harvey's came. Up town after dinner. Saw Mrs. Edwards - Betty Stone.

Sunday May 22, 1898.
To church, morning & evening Preby all out. Saw Hal Robinson. J.M. Lynch & bride.
Monday. - Preacher came down to help me arrange report of previous meetings of Library Assn. Mamma wet to Mrs. Lemons's to make soap. William called to sell an organ. Georgia Post is one year old today. Was in bed until three p.m. Went to League - suly ."Honoring Father and Mother", Leta B - led.
Tuesday. A.G. Donaldson called to learn my decison concerning organ. Wrote to Bertha H.
Sunday May 29, mamma & papa went to Opera House to Memorial Exercise. To church at night. - Preacher "boiled over". Excellent sermon on Why the christians should be interested in the present war.

Monday. Up town, went to cemetery with Mal Hays. - saw everybody. To League only a few present - (band concert). Returned preacher's book - (Washington) 
Tues. Studied a little. pressed out and nearly make silk waist. Mrs. Walters, here. (our garden's nothing but a chunk of mud)
Wed. Finished waist. Studied some To P.O. - letters from Allie & orra - To Fannie's - Bought Grammar Chart $1.25
To church at evening. Schuyler Y - died.
Thurs. June 2. Studied lots. Finished pink and green leaves for mat. Cal R was on hunt of a horse - books, league, corn-
Letters from Iva, Isla & Lou. - After supper Ida x I took a promenad to listen to Band play. Papa commenced plowing for corn. Blocker girls came for unclear of eggs.

Friday June 3. Wrote out some exam & papers. Ida and I went to meeting of Library A Talk on Economics. Got book entitled "Never Too Late To Mend".
Saturday. Swept all over the house. Lute came for extract. To Lecture by Dr. Craven on The Dark & Bright side of India. - ghost story about collection.
Sunday June 5, To church twice. Missionary day. - The Ghost Story acted out. 
To Dunkard S.S.
Monday - Hot - sick. -
Tues. June 7. put down sitting-room carpet. Mr. Shutt here for dinner
Wed. rained did not go to church.
Thurs. big wash. Allie came. Mr. S. here for din Went to Mrs. Ames's - Ella's shirt waist.
Sun. June 12. To church. to children's day

exercises (keep still so you can hear the words of the duet)
Mon, Studied most of the day, got lesson ready to send out. To the preacher's to take topic card - no one at home.
Tues. June 15 papa finished planting corn on Bellamy ground.
Wed. moved stove out in summer kitchen
Thurs. cleaned dining room.
Friday. Mrs. Kidwell & Bessie spent afternoon here. To Lib. A-. Got "Ministry of Art". Papa - "Geo Eliah." got cot (1.25) flower-pots (40) ribbon for mat (15) corset (49) shields (20) vests (20)
Sat. Girls, Bessie & I went to band concert. - Leader's perpetual motion - drawing of woman with two children
Sun. June 19 To S.S. Dr. Day preached. Cal and Ida here for dinner. Harris girl at the altar when church dismissed. E.D. home from church
Mon. Ida led League
Tues. girls picked raspberries (34 qt)
Wed. Up town - stamps (50) tablets (15) letter from 
Sent letter to Orra Q.

Called at Thersea's about three quarter of an hour. Wrote to Lou.
Monday. "School Song" to tune of Yankee Doodle. Big rain from the west just afternoon. Seven rigs at school for the children. Mrs. L. came on load of wheat. Wrote to Belle. Rain poured at night.
Tuesday: - Folks went to Girard. Got looking-glass. sent for slate pencils 10¢. Mrs. L. sick. - got medicine from Dr. Davis. Wore new shoes to school. played dar base all noon. After supper, read some of "Froebel's Gifts" and wrote to Alli. Took us to school and came for us.
Wed. Oct. 12. 1989 - Mrs. Leach quite sick and chilly. Ora washed supper dishes. 
Thursday. I felt so sick and tired, we did not go to Oliver's as we had planned.

Friday Oct. 14. - Splendid day at school. Read to children about Salt, after recess. Hurried home and found folks waiting to go to Girard. Mamma gave Mrs. L. two big squashes and I gave Orra a big geranium. Lute and Carrie called. Letters from Bertha A. and Bertha H. and Program for Local Institute at Palmyra. Papa tired - did not go to Read C.
Saturday Oct. 15 - To Palmyra. Mr. T. took Barney to stable. Saw "Pearcy" at Martin's corner. Ella Edwards in the store. To school building - had quite a chat with Bertha, Orra and Clarence before program began. ("Miss Wormwood" came all the way from Girard to get hints on Composition) If we can teach Girard anything it's our duty to do it.

Talked on every subject, nearly. Went with Lou to Rev. Robertson's for dinner. Mary Watson there, too. We had an all around good Institute. Enjoyed talk with Lou & Dora about Observation Work - seed cabins. Up town with girls. - to store, millinery, O:P., livery-stable. Nellie & I took Orra home. Children fairly danced to see "Miss W." To party at Cap Alford's. - 72 registered. (Nell Arnett thinks she owns the earth 'cause she came with Will Hollingsworth) (Ray Guinn seems to be fond of Berthas) Played "Shouting Proverbs," - R. G. was telling about the "heart-rendering scene"when the soldier boys returned to Monmouth, "I've enjoyed myself, come see me some time". Nellie & I had so much to talk over that we hushed not until II. (E.D. surprise that "somebody" went with Albert.)

Sunday Oct. 16. 1896. - Mrs. G. had sick headache. Clarence showed me his chart for prefixes and suffixes. Fussed over Cyclopedias. Talked about Libraries. Started home about 8 o'clock. Took Nellie home. Arrived in Girard as bells were ringing for church. Staid in town and attended League and church at night.
Monday - Rainy. Barny went flying as far as Madison's. Wrote to Mary D.
Tues - Engaged Oliver as janitor for the remainder of the term for six dol. Sang "Never Say Fail". Wrote to George. Loren rode to school at noon. - Mr. B. thought it was McC's horse.
Wed. Mrs. L. went to Girard - got schedules 10¢. Rode home on load of corn.
Thurs. - Rained and snowed from 8:30 until 4 o'clock, Played Fruit Basket. After Supper, moved things around in my room.
